channel.title: The Ark Newspaper (Full Text)
channel.description: Full-content RSS feed generated from The Ark Newspaper blog.

item.title: Early bunny in Belvedere
item.description: The Ranchs Spring Carnival & Egg Hunt at Belvedere Community Park.

item.title: Dr. Jerome Marvin Weiss
item.description: Dr. Jerome Marvin Weiss, a distinguished urologist and compassionate healer, passed away at the age of 89, in Napa, California, on April 4th.

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A local dad works to pass love of soccer to daughters
item.description: Born in Iran, Tiburon resident Paul Inalou moved to the U.S. at age 12 though he lived in Japan for two years and played on his school's soccer team.

item.title: Tiburon teen turns childhood passion into youth chess network
item.description: Stanley Wong is leading growing after-school programs across Marin and the North Bay.

item.title: Tiburon poet finds healing through verse
item.description: Ashley Moyo uses the spoken word to process grief, identity and life as part of African diaspora.

item.title: Redwood water polo standout on Olympic path
item.description: Reed schools grad Samantha Riley won an invitation to the National Team Selection Camp.

item.title: Man arrested in Denver in connection with 2023 Tiburon armed robbery
item.description: He's been arraigned on felony charges of robbery and negligent discharge of a firearm, both with special enhancements.

item.title: Tiburon lifts 8-year ban on new utility-burying districts
item.description: The Town Council also agreed to help fund some early planning costs.

item.title: Tiburon to celebrate 55th Earth Day with parade, enviro fair
item.description: Tiburons celebration is set for 10 a.m.-1 p.m. April 27.

item.title: Cinelounge owner accuses film institute of unfair exclusivity deals
item.description: The theater owner's complaint says the operator of the Rafael, Sequoia and Mill Valley Film Fest is hurting his business.

item.title: Tiburon Mayor Thier launching Assembly bid
item.description: Tiburon Mayor Holli Thier will join the crowded 2026 contest to replace Damon Connolly in the California State Assembly.

item.title: See collection of ink paintings in new Town Hall exhibit
item.description: Zhongs works will be displayed in the upstairs gallery through June 30, with an artists reception set for 6-8 p.m. May 6.

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A dad passes down his love for baseball to his three children
item.description: Mark Marsella played baseball from age 6 through high school.

item.title: Mill Valley principal tapped to lead Reed Elementary School
item.description: Aubrey OConnor is the new Reed Elementary School principal, replacing Mary Niesyn, who is retiring.

item.title: Angel Island exhibit looks at border surveillance technology
item.description: Border Surveillance: Places, People and Technology features panels detailing technologies used to monitor border crossings from aerostats and drones to fixed cameras and ground sensors.

item.title: Sani 5 OKs $3-mil rehab of aging Cove Road pump station
item.description: Construction is targeted for spring 2026 because it will take up to a year to obtain one of the necessary parts for the upgrade.

item.title: School foundation saddling up for rodeo fundraiser
item.description: The May 10 event for the Reed Union district will feature dinner, dancing and a live auction.

item.title: Tiburon Councilmember Nikfar misses yet another state financial report deadline
item.description: The failure to file reflects a pattern for Nikfar, who missed three disclosure deadlines August 2023 and November 2024 elections.

item.title: Nowruz in motion on Main
item.description: Ballet Afsaneh performs traditional routines during the third annual Nowruz spring festival celebrating the Persian new year on lower...

item.title: Owner: Cinelounge wont close this week despite fundraising urgency
item.description: Email campaign was a Hail Mary to generate support for the transition to a nonprofit.
